Nancy may require constant care for her kidney and daily costly medicine for the rest of her life, but the ACA has given her the chance to fight and inspire Georgians who like Nancy, know that without proper healthcare, they may experience life-terminating kidney failure.

“Without the ACA, I likely would not have quality health insurance right now. My kidney transplant is a pre-existing condition,” said Larson. “If the Trump-GOP lawsuit is successful, insurance companies will be able to once again deny coverage to people like me or price us out.”

Nancy Larson is a hard-working mom who lives in Georgia’s Fourth Congressional District. A recipient of a kidney transplant 15 years ago, without the ACA, Nancy’s condition would be impossible to manage. She would most likely lose her healthcare due to a pre-existing condition. https://t.co/lOVRHSjC2P
